Title: Q and A with senior minister Ismail Sabri

In an interview with the New Straits Times, the senior minister for the security cluster speaks on a wide range of topics, from the implementation of the MCO to the people's discipline and his fashion choices.

Title: MCO-linked domestic violence rises

Teaser: Sabah Chief Minister Datuk Seri Mohd Shafie Apdal and his Sarawakian counterpart, Datuk Patinggi Abang Johari Abang Openg, will be among the top officials sitting in the high-powered cabinet committee formed to realise provisions enshrined in the Malaysia Agreement 1963 (MA63).

Title: [EXCLUSIVE] Rosmah to be charged soon?
Teaser: Datin Seri Rosmah Mansor is expected to formally answer charges of money laundering very soon, after probes that first began more than two years ago were revived.

Title: 'Razak's legacy not just Felda'
Teaser: While many regard the inception of the Federal Land Development Authority as Razak’s most enduring and visible legacy, little had been said about his role in steering the economy amid a challenging socio-economic landscape.

Title: [Exclusive] Staying single due to money woes
Teaser: Money, career and the inability to find the right person are the three main reasons why many Malaysians are single.

Title: [Exclusive] 'Authorities looking into RM3b to RM3.5b in 1MDB case'
Teaser: The RM2.6 billion, which Najib had maintained was “donated” to him, was merely a baseline figure for the investigations, sources with direct knowledge of the case said.

Title: [Exclusive] NRD: Seek our advice when naming kids
Teaser: Registration of unique names is allowed, but parents are encouraged to seek the advice of the National Registration Department (NRD).

Title: [EXCLUSIVE] 'Businessman arrested in Thailand not linked to Najib, Jho Low'
Teaser: THE businessman arrested in Thailand by the Malaysian Anti-Corruption Commission (MACC) over the SRC International Sdn Bhd case is not linked to former prime minister Datuk Seri Najib Razak and financier Low Taek Jho, also known as Jho Low.

Title: [EXCLUSIVE] Why the A-GC dropped LGE's case
Teaser: The difficulty in proving that the bungalow deal was carried out ‘for a consideration which Lim Guan Eng knew to be inadequate’ was why the charges against the former Penang chief minister and businesswoman Phang Li Koon were withdrawn.

Title: [EXCLUSIVE] Up to A-G to decide on appeal
Teaser: The power is in the attorney-general’s (A-G) hands whether his chambers will appeal against the High Court’s acquittal of Finance Minister Lim Guan Eng in his corruption case.

Title: [EXCLUSIVE] 'Works Ministry always uses open-tender system'
Teaser: Two months after heading the Works Ministry, Selangau member of parliament Baru Bian has found himself surrounded by hot issues, including the government’s decision on the Pan-Borneo Highway Phase Two from Limbang to Lawas and toll abolishment, as promised in Pakatan Harapan’s manifesto.

Title: [EXCLUSIVE] '1MDB probe to wrap up by year end'
Teaser: Investigations into the 1Malaysia Development Bhd (1MDB) scandal are expected to wrap up by year end.

Title: [EXCLUSIVE] 'Missing' yellow from attire?
Teaser: MANY Malaysians are puzzled as to why the colour yellow was “missing” from the National Day celebration official attire, worn by ministers in Putrajaya on Friday.

Title: [EXCLUSIVE] 1MDB funds scattered across the globe
Teaser: THOSE probing the 1Malaysia Development Bhd (1MDB) case believe that most of the company’s more than RM20 billion that is unaccounted for, is being held by individuals scattered across the globe, including in the Middle East.

Title: [EXCLUSIVE] Missing US$12 million linked to 1MDB?
Teaser: INVESTIGATORS are hot on the trail of the US$12 million (RM49 million) said to belong to the government, but allegedly found its way surreptitiously to the office of the Malaysian External Intelligence Organisation (MEIO).

Title: [EXCLUSIVE] Yeoh: Criminalising suicide bid archaic
Teaser: SECTION 309 of Penal Code, which criminalises suicide, is archaic and should be reviewed as it doesn’t stop anyone from committing it, said Deputy Women, Community and Family Development Minister Hannah Yeoh.

Title: [EXCLUSIVE] 'I still harbour thoughts of killing myself' (NSTTV)
Teaser: “THE voices in my head told me how useless and hopeless I was. Suddenly, I realised I was at the edge of the highway and cars were honking frantically,” said Sue, 39, who had attempted to end her life many times.

Title: [EXCLUSIVE] Employees will benefit from workplace counsellors (NSTTV)
Teaser: THE government should consider making it compulsory for corporations to provide in-house counsellors to help employees manage their mental health problems.

Title: [EXCLUSIVE] Over 2,000 suicide cases in the past four years (NSTTV)
Teaser: POLICE statistics show that there were more than 500 cases of people committing suicide or attempting suicide every year for the past four years.

Title: [EXCLUSIVE] Attempting suicide is a cry for help (NSTTV)
Teaser: AL Juhar Jamal Hussin, 19, tried to set himself ablaze during a protest at the Myanmar embassy in Kuala Lumpur. His parents were dead and the Rohingya teen felt all alone, stranded in a foreign country.

Title: Mixed views on decision to sell yacht
Teaser: THE jury is still out on whether the government is on the right track, legally, in its plan to dispose of Equanimity, which is in its custody.

Title: [EXCLUSIVE] Wanita PKR candidates strong on 'reformasi'
Teaser: BOTH candidates vying for the Wanita PKR chief post in the party’s poll have their own advantages and ideas on how to take the party forward in line with its “reformasi” spirit.

Title: Low rank of country's defence assets due to unsuitability: expert
Teaser: MALAYSIA’S defence assets are lowly ranked among Southeast Asian countries because of a mismatch in demand and supply, and politically-motivated procurements, an expert in the field of security said.

Title: [EXCLUSIVE] Rafizi: My approach is different than Azmin's
Teaser: PKR vice-president Rafizi Ramli is no stranger to controversies. He is well-known for a series of exposés that had contributed to the downfall of BN in the 14th General Election (GE14).

Title: Khalid Ibrahim: Why the Selangor water deal is a betrayal of the people
Teaser: After a more than 10-year wait, the restructuring of Selangor’s water industry has finally begun, with the final water concessionaire company on its way to being acquired by the state government.

Title: [Exclusive] 'Apply laws to foreign labour too'
Teaser: IT is high time the government seriously looked into measures, including those unpopular with industry players, to reduce the nation’s dependency on foreign workers.

Title: Industry urges 'final round' of rehiring programme
Teaser: KUALA LUMPUR Industry players have appealed to the government to consider a ‘final round’ of the illegal foreign workers rehiring programme.

Title: 'Introduce foreign worker ratio system'
Teaser: KUALA LUMPUR The government should introduce a ratio system that allows for the hiring of a maximum number of foreign workers in a company based on its total workforce.

Title: [Exclusive] Islamic panel to meet on Thursday
Teaser: The high-level panel on the federal institutions of Islam will convene for its first meeting this Thursday to address matters pertaining to Islamic administration, including in Sabah and Sarawak.

Title: 'Only 150 officers to man 544,000ha of Terengganu's forest'
Teaser: ‘We only have 150 enforcement officers to monitor 544,000ha of forest reserve in the state,’ said state Forestry Department director Datuk Ahmad Fadzil Abdul Majid.

Title: [Exclusive] Terengganu loses millions to illegal logging
Teaser: The Terengganu government has lost millions of ringgit in revenue from illegal logging in forests reserves over the past 10 years with little success in wiping out syndicates behind such activities.

Title: Going all out to protect Terengganu's forest reserves
Teaser: The 10-men state Forestry Department enforcement unit will go all out to protect forest reserves despite being shot at, intimidated and threatened with machetes by illegal loggers and their syndicate leaders.

Title: Employers urge govt to be practical in setting cap
Teaser: The government’s aim to cap the percentage of foreign workers in the local job market at 15 per cent by 2020 should be reconsidered.

Title: 'Agents to blame for huge number of illegal foreign workers'
Teaser: ENFORCEMENT agencies that vowed to rid the country of all illegal immigrants must recognise the actual number out there to address this problem once and for all, said those in direct contact with labour-intensive economic sectors.

Title: [Exclusive] Calls for automatic voter registration
Teaser: THE government’s plan to reduce the minimum voting age from 21 to 18 has triggered calls to introduce an automatic voter registration system.

Title: [Exclusive] 'PH will rid country of illegals within a month'
Teaser: THE task at hand may be monumental, but the government is confident that it can deliver what it said the previous government failed to accomplish — rid the country of illegal immigrants.

Title: [Exclusive] Cops arrest 8 men, seize RM7m worth of syabu from car in Ampang Jaya mall parking lot [NSTTV]
Teaser: Police seized syabu worth RM7 million when they raided the parking lot of a popular shopping centre in Ampang Jaya on Saturday.

Title: [Exclusive] Another child bride case
Teaser: AS the controversy surrounding a 41-year-old man who married an 11-year-old girl continues to simmer, another case of a child bride has been reported here.

Title: [Exclusive] All set for a straight fight
Teaser: IN a bid to ensure the votes are contained within the opposition bloc, Umno and Pas have agreed to put up only one candidate in the Sungai Kandis by-election.

Title: [Exclusive] Najib: GST still the better tax system
Teaser: Former prime minister Datuk Seri Najib Razak, who introduced the Goods and Services Tax (GST) during his administration, believes that the tax is better than the Sales and Services Tax (SST).

Title: [Exclusive] 'We are 99pc prepared for Asian Games 2018'
Teaser: Media Prima News And Current Affairs’ exclusive interview with Indonesian President Joko Widodo.

Title: [Exclusive] 28 Integrity Officers to be reinstated
Teaser: TWENTY-EIGHT Certified Integrity Officers (CeIOs) with the Malay-sian Anti-Corruption Commission (MACC) will be reinstated in ministries and departments to intensify efforts to weed out graft and abuse of power in the public sector.

Title: [Exclusive] 'Jho Low may have had help'
Teaser: Fugitive businessman Low Taek Jho, or better known as Jho Low, may have had help to evade international law enforcement officials. His movements may have been coordinated by hired experts, using channels already put in place by transnational criminal groups.

Title: [Exclusive] New law to govern ministers
Teaser: PUTRAJAYA is pushing for specific legal provisions that will minimise the exposure of those holding public office to corruption and abuse of power. The plan is to lump politicians with civil servants, and have them governed under a proposed law — Public Officials Misconduct Act.

Title: [Exclusive] Police will know if you watch porn
Teaser: A new police unit, equipped with the latest technology right out of Mission Impossible movies, has been recently set up to sniff out online pornography.

Title: [Exclusive] Ignore child abuse at your own risk
Teaser: CHILDREN, including those at the most vulnerable age, are becoming victims of abuse.

Title: [Exclusive] Freeze on accounts 'to be lifted once cleared of suspicious transactions'
Teaser: The Malaysian Anti-Corruption Commission’s (MACC) move to freeze 408 bank accounts is part of the probe into the 1Malaysia Development Bhd (1MBD) scandal.

Title: 'I am driven by people's aspirations'
Teaser: She was the first woman to assume the role of an opposition leader when Malaysia was under the Barisan Nasional regime.

Title: 'Anwar is DPM?...Give me some credit'
Teaser: Talk around town has been malicious against the country’s first female deputy prime minister, Datuk Seri Dr Wan Azizah Wan Ismail. Some quarters claim that it is her husband, Datuk Seri Anwar Ibrahim, who is the deputy prime minister and not her.

Title: [Exclusive]: RM600m 'channelled' into Umno's account
Teaser: THE freezing of Umno’s coffers at the central and state chapters has been linked to an alleged RM600 million that was deposited into the party’s account.

Title: Is Umno's 'menu' for use or abuse?
Teaser: IN Umno, there is an age-old tradition called cai (pronounced as chai). It is short for cai dan, which means “menu” in Mandarin. In the past, the future of Umno is said to be written on a cai, which was actually a preferred list of candidates for party positions.

Title: [Exclusive] 900 accounts linked to 1MDB frozen
Teaser: THE Malaysian Anti-Corruption Commission (MACC) has frozen about 900 accounts traced to that of 1Malaysia Development Bhd (1MDB).

Title: 'Azmin, Rafizi have their own styles'
Teaser: Are there three camps in PKR? What happens if Anwar doesn’t become PM? Does Dr M plan to remain as PM beyond two years? PKR vice-president Nurul Izzah Anwar, known to reporters as ‘Puteri Reformasi’, tells the New Straits Times that not being in the cabinet won’t stop her from protecting and empowering women and children

Title: 'Not easy for Khairy to win presidency'
Teaser: PKR vice-president Nurul Izzah Anwar has welcomed Umno Youth chief Khairy Jamaluddin’s decision to run for the Umno presidency.

Title: 'Papa would make a wonderful PM'
Teaser: Nurul Izzah Anwar believes that her father, Datuk Seri Anwar Ibrahim, will make a “wonderful prime minister”.

Title: Keenly-watched Umno election
Teaser: UMNO’S Wanita, Youth and Puteri wings will go to the polls tomorrow to vote for their respective leaders and executive council members.

Title: All eyes on Umno's top post
Teaser: TENGKU Razaleigh Hamzah’s Jalan Langgak Golf office-cum-house was not short of visitors the week before Hari Raya Aifilfitri. And these were not the customary pre-Raya visits before they returned to their hometowns to celebrate the first of Syawal. Some came on their own while others came in groups. And there were those who made multiple visits to see him.

Title: Perlis BN assemblymen reiterate support for Azlan as MB
Teaser: The nine Barisan Nasional assemblymen who had at first boycotted the swearing-in of Menteri Besar Datuk Seri Azlan Man have reiterated their new stand of being fully behind their state leader.

Title: Fierce battle looms as fresh faces challenge Umno veterans
Teaser: AS the Umno polls draw nearer, talk is rife on the formation of two teams contesting for top posts.

Title: 'Many not keen to venture into livestock business'
Teaser: The dearth of livestock farming and cheap meat imports in the past six years have affected Malaysia’s self-sufficiency in livestock (SSL), said Veterinary Services Department director-general Datuk Dr Quaza Nizamuddin Hassan Nizam.

Title: NFC to be revived
Teaser: The National Feedlot Corporation (NFC) will be revived with a different business model and renamed as the government still aims to have its own national feedlot centre.

Title: [EXCLUSIVE] Fully occupied for disaster - thousands of 'high-risk' buildings
Teaser: THOUSANDS of buildings, many housing no fewer than 1,000 people at any one time, may be unfit for occupation.

Title: Two more foreign predatory fishes threaten survival of native species
Teaser: First local anglers reported catching the pacu, a fish related to the piranha family, and the African catfish (Clarias gariepinus), then the Chao Phraya high fin catfish (Pangasius sanitwongsei), the peacock bass, a carnivorous genus of large cichlids, and the gargantuan redtail catfish (Phractocephalus hemioliopterus) were caught in the country’s rivers, lakes and dams.

Title: (EXCLUSIVE) Abdul Hamid returns to Special Branch, reports for duty as chief
Teaser: Datuk Abdul Hamid Bador has returned to the Special Branch as its chief.

Title: [EXCLUSIVE] Sirul must reveal extra info he claims he has, says ex-top cop
Teaser: Former Inspector-General of Police Tan Sri Musa Hassan said former policeman Sirul Azhar Umar must reveal the extra information he claimed he has regarding the murder of Mongolian model Altantuya Shaariibuu in 2006.

Title: Bookies ready to take in bets on GE14
Teaser: Federal police have established a special team to monitor and tackle syndicates which are taking bets on the 14th General Election results.

Title: Polling on May 5 or 9?
Teaser: The burning question of when Malaysians will go to the polls to choose their government for the 14th parliamentary term is expected to be answered today.

Title: [Exclusive] Nation goes into high gear for GE14
Teaser: The wait is nearly over. The momentum for the 14th General Election (GE14) enters its final lap this month, with the polling day likely to take place in the first few days of May.

Title: [Exclusive] D9 unit formed to bring down secret societies
Teaser: Before the Special Task Force on Organised Crime and the Special Tactical Intelligence Narcotics Group came to be, all efforts to fight organised crime fell on the shoulders of the Criminal Investigation Department’s Serious Crime unit.

Title: [Exclusive] War against organised crime began in 2016: Police
Teaser: POLICE have long declared an all-out war against organised crime groups in the country and have been conducting operations to track members down.

Title: [Exclusive] Every vote counts - EC Chief
Teaser: The Election Commission’s redelineation report, tabled by Prime Minister Datuk Seri Najib Razak, was passed yesterday. The New Straits Times Press met EC chairman Tan Sri Mohd Hashim Abdullah, who touched on the perception of the commission, its court battle and the impact of fake news

Title: [Exclusive] Chairman defends EC's integrity
Teaser: Election Commission (EC) chairman Tan Sri Mohd Hashim Abdullah yesterday said the commission should not be turned into a target for lies and slander.

Title: RM300 fine means they will be at it again
Teaser: A few metres away, several pairs of eyes were watching the learner driver, and more intently, the woman instructor next to her.

Title: RTD reviewing outdated laws to improve enforcement
Teaser: The Road Transport Department (RTD) is reviewing old and irrelevant laws under its jurisdiction for better enforcement.

Title: It's time to teach 'instructors' a lesson
Teaser: Some driving schools are skimping on operational costs by hiring any Tom, Dick and Harry to teach learner drivers.

Title: Stranded drug mule comes home
Teaser: “I want to hug my mother. I miss her so much.” After being stranded in a foreign country for 12 years, this is what Nor Suzanna Azmi wants to do when she arrives at the Kuala Lumpur International Airport tomorrow.

Title: [Exclusive] 'Fake news law to boost existing acts'
Teaser: Existing laws involving fake news will not be repealed, but instead be read together with the newly proposed act when it is tabled in Parliament. The new law will strengthen existing acts, the Malaysian Communications and Multimedia Commission (MCMC) said.

Title: [Exclusive] BN to name candidates on April 2
Teaser: Prime Minister Datuk Seri Najib Razak is expected to announce Barisan Nasional’s full list of 14th General Election (GE14) candidates on April 2, five days before he launches BN’s election mani-festo.

Title: 'Not enough women in corporate boards'
Teaser: The Wanita Barisan Nasional chief was baffled why the effort to include more women in the boardroom was slow despite the pool of talented women leaders in the private sector.

Title: Worrying: Cancer patients trust bomoh more
Teaser: MORE than half of cancer patients in Kelantan trust alternative treatments, such as homeopathy, taking herbal drinks and seeking help from bomoh.

Title: 'Govt mulls rebates for consumers'
Teaser: THE government may introduce a rebate system to compensate consumers for water shortages caused by negligence.

Title: BN to unveil manifesto on April 7
Teaser: BARISAN Nasional is expected to reveal its manifesto on a grand scale at Stadium Putra in Bukit Jalil on April 7.

Title: Desperate dad hopes 2 sons get Malaysian citizenship
Teaser: ‘I want to wear a school uniform and join my friends to learn at school.’

Title: [Exclusive] Cross-border marriage amnesty programme to protect stateless kids'
Teaser: The cross-border marriage amnesty programme proposed by the Kedah government should be seen as a move to protect the welfare of children born to couples who married outside the country and did not register their union.

Title: [Exclusive] Police mull noise pollution law to tackle mat rempit menace
Teaser: Police are reviewing the way they handle mat rempit to improve ways to control the problem.

Title: Don't glorify illegal racers, says NGO
Teaser: Those involved in illegal street motor racing should not be glorified with titles, including mat rempit.

Title: Sundays are great for mat rempit
Teaser: The tourists were looking uneasy as they took their last shots of the iconic Sultan Abdul Samad Building here.

Title: Dissolution at the end of March?
Teaser: The tabling of the motion on the redelineation of electoral borders, initially scheduled for March 29, has been brought forward, indicating the possibility that Parliament will be dissolved either at the end of the month, or early next month to pave the way for the 14th General Election (GE14).

Title: [Exclusive] MH370: A wave of optimism sweeps team
Teaser: The team scouring the depths of the southern Indian Ocean for Malaysia Airlines Flight MH370 that disappeared exactly four years ago is optimistic that the deep will finally give up its secrets.

Title: [Exclusive] Plan of action when MH370 is found
Teaser: AS the international search team braves the treacherous winter and stormy weather in the southern Indian Ocean, Malaysian officials back home are putting their heads together to prepare a recovery plan for when Malaysia Airlines Flight MH370 is found.

Title: [Exclusive] Faith in new plan to fight drug abuse [NSTTV]
Teaser: A large number of drug addicts are undergoing a special programme that not only promises to reduce the prospect of relapse, but also to give them a better chance of reassimilating into society.

Title: Fight drug abuse: Parents pray children turn over a new leaf
Teaser: A mother thought her world was crashing when she received a call informing her that her son had been arrested for drug abuse.

Title: 'Free water in Selangor possible because of Federal Government'
Teaser: The Selangor government has claimed that under its administration, people have been enjoying free water.

Title: Selangor taps keep running dry
Teaser: DRY taps. Water tankers making their way to housing estates. A long queue of people holding pails and water containers waiting for the precious commodity.

Title: Smugglers looking for legitimate work
Teaser: The armed forces’ stringent move to curtail smuggling along the Kelantan-Thailand is so effective that smugglers are starting to look for legitimate work.

Title: Smuggling down by 50pc
Teaser: The armed forces’ move to tighten security along the 128km-long Kelantan-Thailand border has seen a 50 per cent drop in smuggling activities.

Title: No maids for you if you have a record
Teaser: Malaysians red-flagged for having criminal records, being a bankrupt or failing to show proof that they are able to be good paymasters will not be allowed to take in foreign maids.

Title: EXCLUSIVE: Bosses warned to follow laws on foreign workers
Teaser: BOSSES who make their foreign workers pay the employment levy imposed by the government will be held liable under the law.

Title: Invasion of the business snatchers [NSTTV]
Teaser: The problem is real. Immigrants are taking over many small- and medium-scale businesses in strategic locations and Malaysians are allowing it to happen right under their noses.

Title: 65 drowned in first two months of 2018
Teaser: FRD deputy director-general (operations) Datuk Soiman Jahid said the hike in drowning cases was alarming, adding that most of them took place at beaches, rivers, waterfalls, lakes/mines or sewers.

Title: [Exclusive] Q&A: Khalid Ibrahim tackles controversial Ijok land deal
Teaser: Former Selangor Menteri Besar Tan Sri Khalid Ibrahim created a stir recently when he criticised the Selangor government’s controversial decision to withdraw its court case concerning plots of land in Ijok against two developers. In an exclusive interview, he lays bare his views on the matter to NSTP reporters.

Title: No smoking campaigns having impact on the young
Teaser: BOLD “Tak Nak” or “Say No” to cigarette posters dot government offices and hospitals. It’s hard not to notice them.

Title: EPF building fire: Did the Grenfell tragedy nearly happen here?
Teaser: Did Malaysia very nearly have its own Grenfell Tower tragedy? Just how many buildings are there in the country which use polyethylene, or polyfoam, as cladding?

Title: EXCLUSIVE: Children exploited by drug addict parents
Teaser: A MOTHER was found to have used her two-month-old baby for money to satisfy her drug addiction.

Title: [Exclusive] Terrorists get fake IDs for RM350
Teaser: HIGH-RISK elements, including suspected foreign terrorists, have leveraged the availability of forged Malaysian identification documents to stay under the radar.

Title: [Exclusive] It's a challenge to detect fake cards
Teaser: Syndicates forging Malaysian identification documents have upped the game in their illicit trade.

Title: Dyslexia: Are we reading the problem right?
Teaser: IT takes a trained eye to identify a child with dyslexia and, more often than not, many are passed off as lazy or unintelligent.

Title: Dyslexia: 'Growing up, I was labelled lazy and stupid'
Teaser: HE was often punished for his poor grades at the Chinese primary school he attended in Penang.

Title: Dyslexia did not stop pilot from achieving dreams
Teaser: Who would have thought that the man who dared to travel solo around the world in a single-engine Cessna 210 Silver Eagle aircraft at the age of 21, was once a victim of bullying.

Title: [Exclusive] High prices ramp up pork smuggling along Kelantan-Thai border
Teaser: Lucrative pork prices, as high as RM100 per kg in Thailand, are one of the main reasons pork is being actively smuggled across the Kelantan border.

Title: [Exclusive] '3P' to bring order to old flats [NSTtv]
Teaser: A legally-established body that will serve to address common issues at low- and medium-cost apartments is underway.

Title: Spotlight: Beat the scammers
Teaser: THE rise of Quick Response (QR) code scams is putting e-payment security in the spotlight.

Title: EXCLUSIVE: 'Director lived a lavish lifestyle, owned factory'
Teaser: HE had reportedly amassed millions of ringgit, had a lavish lifestyle and could even afford to own a factory processing drinking water.

Title: Workplace woes: Workplace discrimination is common in Malaysia
Teaser: MALAYSIA stands where it is today from the hard work of its multicultural society who come together as one.

Title: [Exclusive] Help is just a phone call away
Teaser: WHEN K-Pop star Kim Jong-hyun committed suicide last month, help group Befrienders Kuala Lumpur received 800 emails, mostly from young people.

Title: Labour shortage in Cameron Highlands
Teaser: ACUTE labour shortage is threatening Cameron Highlands’ agricultural sector, which can lead to severe financial losses for farmers and rising vegetable prices.

Title: Abu Zahar: Taking officers out will disrupt battle against graft
Teaser: The removal of Malaysian Anti-Corruption Commission (MACC) officers from government agencies, including those classified as high and medium risk, has not gone down well with those encouraged by the country’s progress in the war against graft.

Title: Integrity officer shocker: MACC men pulled from govt agencies
Teaser: FORTY-SEVEN Certified Integrity Officers (CeIOs) with the Malaysian Anti-Corruption Commission (MACC) tasked with smoking out corruption and abuse of power in the civil service have been yanked out from ministries and agencies they were overseeing.

Title: EXCLUSIVE: Many facing thumbprint woes
Teaser: The thumbprint verification system for a host of public facilities is posing problems to an increasing number of Malaysians.

Title: Penang undersea tunnel project: Probe to focus on RM305m fee
Teaser: THE Malaysian Anti-Corruption Commission’s investigation into the proposed Penang undersea tunnel project will focus on the RM305 million paid to the project’s consultant using two plots of land near Tanjung Tokong.

Title: Survival of the endangered
Teaser: More needs to be done to ensure the survival of some of the world’s most endangered wildlife species. At least one, the Sumatran rhino, is virtually gone in the wild, except for two, a male and female in captivity. A few conservationists told the ‘New Sunday Times’ about their frustrations, challenges and hopes.

Title: IS fighters may build dirty bombs with radioactive materials
Teaser: Fears are growing that Islamic State (IS) group fighters, including their sympathisers here, may attempt to build dirty bombs using radioactive products.

Title: Radiation risk in home construction materials
Teaser: NUCLEAR and radiation experts are cautioning the public over potential hazards posed by naturally-occurring radioactive elements in construction materials.

Title: Getting the right formula in war against drugs
Teaser: THE number of drug users, addicts and drug-related offenders continues to rise in Malaysia over the years, raising concerns about how to move forward and whether the country is taking the right approach.

Title: [Exclusive] Industrial pollution ravaging Sg Chalok's once vibrant ecosystem
Teaser: Sungai Chalok in Penarik used to be a national hotspot for shrimp (udang galah) anglers, as it allowed them to snag as many as five kilogrammes of the crustaceans within less than half a day.

Title: [Exclusive] No-go for lapbelts from January
Teaser: The Transport Ministry will, from January, compel all manufacturers of passenger vehicles to fit their models with the three-point seatbelt.

Title: Lapbelts have caused fatal injuries
Teaser: The lapbelt installed in the middle rear seat in many cars have been associated with fatal injuries.

Title: Makeover plan for squalid flats
Teaser: Malaysians forced to get by living in squalid apartments with little space and no parking lots can look forward to better living conditions.

Title: [Exclusive] 'Don't pass on foreign worker levy to employees'
Teaser: Employers who pass on the foreign worker levy to their employees can be charged under the Employment Act.

Title: Finding peace for Bangsamoro
Teaser: The Moro Islamic Liberation Front, however, cautions that efforts to rein in existing and emerging extremist groups would be difficult, tenuous at best, without the passage of the Bangsamoro Basic Law (BBL).

Title: Hoping for peace in Mindanao
Teaser: The intense determination to ensure that all milestones in attaining the elusive hope for lasting peace in Mindano is not derailed was evident.

Title: Policies to promote a healthier nation
Teaser: ANEW set of policies to build a healthier Malaysia is currently being put in place.

Title: Human trafficking: Syndicates carry on blithely
Teaser: Human trafficking syndicates have remained unfazed in the face of heavy punishment as they can reap huge profits from the illegal trade.

Title: Wang Kelian mass graves: Bukit Aman responds to NST
Teaser: The New Straits Times’ expose on the Wang Kelian tragedy has ignited demands for answers. Five days after our first report came out, federal police have responded to the 17 burning questions raised by our Probes team. The Bukit Aman answers are verbatim.

Title: DNA link may bring closure to families
Teaser: The New Straits Times Special Probes Team has established that there is a DNA-matching system that can provide at least some form of closure.

Title: 'MACC ready to help Police'
Teaser: The Malaysian Anti-Corruption Commission (MACC) is prepared to assist police in establishing if there were elements of corruption or abuse of power, in the investigations into the 2015 Wang Kelian trafficking tragedy.

Title: Time of celebration for state
Teaser: The highlight for Kelantan in 2017 was the installation of Sultan Muhammad V as the Yang di-Pertuan Agong.

Title: Wang Kelian cover-up: 'The file is still open'
Teaser: Police will investigate any and all new leads in the 2015 Wang Kelian human trafficking tragedy, following the expose by the New Straits Times Special Probes Team yesterday.

Title: Rohingya leaders demand justice following Wang Kelian exposé
Teaser: Many of the Rohingya migrants who died in the Wang Kelian tragedy could have been saved if police had taken immediate action upon discovering the death camps in early January 2015.

Title: [EXCLUSIVE] The secrets of Wang Kelian exposed

Teaser: THE body of Kim Jong-nam has been embalmed.

Teaser: The government has allocated RM2.05 billion for the purchase of Covid-19 vaccines for Malaysians, said Science, Technology and Innovation Minister Khairy Jamaluddin.

Title: No changes in electricity tariff until June [NSTTV]

Teaser: The report from a special task force, set up to address Felda-related issues, is ready to be tabled to the Cabinet, said Minister in the Prime Minister’s Department (Economy), Datuk Seri Mustapa Mohamed.

Title: PM reaffirms govt commitment to eradicating income inequality
Teaser: Strong foundations built over time made a fast-developing nation like Malaysia resilient and responsive in overcoming challenges, including those brought about by the Covid-19 pandemic.

Title: Dr Noor Hisham: Those arriving from Sabah must undergo screening, quarantine
Teaser: Individuals returning from Sabah must undergo mandatory home quarantine beginning tomorrow as per the Health Ministry’s Home Surveillance Order (HSO) rules.

Title: What fine? It's straight to jail for first-time drink drivers
Teaser: Drink driving offenders will no longer be slapped with fines but will also be jailed once the Road Transport Act (Amendment) Bill 2020, to be tabled at the Dewan Negara next week, is passed and gazetted.

Title: PM announces increase in fishermen's Elaun Sara Hidup
Teaser: The government will raise the Elaun Sara Hidup for fishermen from RM250 back to RM300 per month, said Prime Minister Tan Sri Muhyiddin Yassin here today.

Title: New environmental crime prevention unit to go down hard on polluters
Teaser: An elite environmental crime prevention unit comprising personnel from several government agencies is set to come down hard on polluters.

Title: Ministry has strategies for tourism recovery
Teaser: THE Covid-19 pandemic has badly affected the country’s tourism sector, with only 4.2 million international tourist arrivals and RM12.6 billion in tourism receipts so far this year.

Title: Mustapa: Govt to standardise regulations, taxes for hotels, Airbnb
Teaser: The government is finalising discussions on the standardisation of several issues involving the hotel sector and Airbnb, such as regulations and taxes.

Title: Government steadfast in uplifting Bumi agenda
Teaser: The government’s decision to create the Bumiputera Prosperity Council (Majlis Kemakmuran Bumiputera) is a reflection of its commitment to continue empowering the Bumiputera, said Prime Minister Tan Sri Muhyiddin Yassin today.

Title: Jendela to focus on developing communication infrastructure in Sabah
Teaser: The implementation of the Jalinan Digital Negara (Jendela) plan will focus on communication infrastructure development projects in Sabah from 2020 to 2022, said the Malaysian Communications and Multimedia Commission (MCMC).

Title: 'Prihatin saved 1.4 million jobs'
Teaser: The Prihatin Rakyat Economic Stimulus Package’s (Prihatin) Wage Subsidy Programme launched in March has helped over 1.4 million people in the country keep their jobs amid the Covid-19 pandemic.

Title: Act 505 Amendments to be tabled in November
Teaser: The government plans to table amendments to the Administration of Islamic Law (Federal Territories) 1993 (Act 505) in the next parliament session in November, Minister in the Prime Minister's Department (Religious Affairs) Datuk Seri Dr Zulkifli Mohamad Al-Bakri said.

Title: Dewan Negara begins today
Teaser: The Dewan Negara which convenes today on the first day of the Second Meeting of the Third Term of the 14th Parliament will focus on the appointment of a new Senate president.

Title: Azmin: Govt focusing on RCEP, to explore other FTAs later
Teaser: The government is currently focusing on Regional Comprehensive Economic Partnership (RCEP) negotiations and will later look at other free trade agreements (FTAs), including the Comprehensive and Progressive Agreement for Trans-Pacific Partnership (CPTPP).

Title: IPCC bill to be passed in next Dewan Rakyat sitting
Teaser: The tabling of the Independent Police Conduct Commission (IPCC) Bill 2020 for its second and third reading will be postponed to the next sitting in November.

Title: IPCC bill tabled in Dewan Rakyat
Teaser: The Independent Police Conduct Commission (IPCC) Act 2020 bill has been tabled for its first reading in the Dewan Rakyat today by Deputy Home Minister Datuk Seri Ismail Mohamed Said.

Title: Government will not reveal details of Tabung Harapan's donors [NSTTV]
Teaser: The government will not reveal the details of Tabung Harapan Malaysia's donors, the Dewan Rakyat was told today.

Title: Home Ministry proposes segregating prisoners by level of offence
Teaser: The Home Ministry is proposing segregating inmates in prisons according to their level of offences to reduce recidivism and to allow for suitable rehabilitation programmes to be run for each group.

Title: Amendments to Co-operative Societies Act 1993 tabled in Dewan Rakyat
Teaser: Amendments to the Co-operative Societies Act 1993 (Act 502) has been tabled for its first reading in the Dewan Rakyat today by Deputy Entrepreneur Development And Cooperatives Minister Datuk Mas Ermieyati Samsudin.

Title: RM10mil allocated for urban agriculture project under Penjana
Teaser: The Federal government has allocated RM10 million for Urban Agriculture Project under the National Economic Recovery Plan (Penjana).

Title: Efforts ongoing to eradicate abuse, sexual crimes against children, says Siti Zailah
Teaser: The Women, Family and Community Development Ministry will continue to work closely with other ministries as well as cooperate at the international level in its efforts to combat online child sexual exploitation and abuse.

Title: Government mulling to make MySejahtera compulsory for certain premises
Teaser: The government is mulling to make it compulsory for certain types of premises to only use the MySejahtera application developed by the government to assist in managing Covid-19 outbreak including close contact tracing.

Title: Malaysia launches Sukuk Prihatin, maiden digital Islamic bond
Teaser: The government has launched the RM500 million Sukuk Prihatin which aims to raise funds from the public and corporates who wish to help contribute towards the Covid-19 Fund.

Title: Minister: GST, SST have little impact on price of goods
Teaser: The price of goods in Malaysia is more significantly influenced by supply and demand than the tax system currently in place, said Deputy Domestic Trade and Consumer Affairs Minister, Datuk Rosol Wahid.

Title: Santiago calls for i-Lestari EPF reimbursement to the poor
Teaser: A Pakatan Harapan Member of Parliament has called for additional measures to protect the poor by reimbursing the RM500 Employees Provident Fund (EPF) Account 2 withdrawal made by the public through the government’s i-Lestari scheme.

Title: Singapore-Malaysia cross-border travel resumes; returnees quarantined
Teaser: Malaysians returning from Singapore under the Reciprocal Green Lane (RGL) and Periodic Commuting Arrangement (PCA) schemes have been reminded to strictly adhere to home quarantine rules.

Title: Foreigners need to pay up front for Covid-19 tests before allowed to enter [NSTTV]
Teaser: Foreigners who are allowed to enter Malaysia are now required to pay for the Covid-19 screening tests and quarantine fees upon their arrival at the entry point.

Title: Rehiring foreign workers is allowed, with conditions
Teaser: Employers are allowed to rehire foreign workers who were retrenched earlier, but Malaysian workers must be given priority to fill job vacancies.

Title: PM to chair Bumiputera Prosperity Council to facilitate development [NSTTV]
Teaser: Prime Minister Tan Sri Muhyiddin Yassin said he will chair the Bumiputera Prosperity Council (Majlis Kemakmuran Bumiputera) to steer and speed up the development of the Bumiputera economy as part of the national agenda.

Title: Immigration post at Menumbok crucial to prevent illegal entry of foreigners
Teaser: The Federal government should set up an immigration post in Menumbok to control the entry of foreigners into the state.

Title: Zulkefli: RUU355 amendments will hopefully take place before I die
Teaser: Minister in the Prime Minister’s Department (Religious Affairs) Datuk Seri Dr Zulkefli Mohamad said the amendments to the Syariah Courts (Criminal Jurisdiction) Act (RUU355) will hopefully be realised “before he dies”.

Title: MACC seeks law to make asset declaration compulsory for MPs
Teaser: The Malaysian Anti-Corruption Commission (MACC) is seeking a law to make it compulsory for Members of Parliament to declare their assets, said MACC deputy chief commissioner (prevention), Datuk Shamshun Baharin Mohd Jamil.

Title: Increased penalties in Act 716 to also target online wildlife trades
Teaser: Enforcement of increased penalties for online wildlife trade activities which have been rampant on social media will be possible with amendments to the Wildlife Conservation Act (Act 716) to be tabled this year.

Title: Govt to study UNHCR's presence in Malaysia, says Home Minister
Teaser: Putrajaya will study the presence of the United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees (UNHCR) in Malaysia, Home Minister Datuk Seri Hamzah Zainudin said.

Title: Tengku Zafrul: Socso approved RM8.97bil under wage subsidy scheme
Teaser: The Social Security Organisation (Socso) has approved RM8.97 billion under the wage subsidy programme as of July 24 benefiting over 2.58 million workers, says Finance Minister Tengku Datuk Seri Zafrul Abdul Aziz.

Title: Govt freezes MM2H for review
Teaser: The government has decided to temporarily suspend the Malaysia My Second Home Programme (MM2H) to allow Tourism, Arts and Culture Ministry and related agencies to comprehensively review and re-evaluate the programme since its inception in 2002.

Title: Gov't mulls contempt of court law as public criticism of judiciary mounts
Teaser: The government is mulling over a special law to address cases related to contempt of court, the Dewan Rakyat was told today.

Title: Petrol Subsidy Programme scrapped
Teaser: The government has decided not to proceed with plans to implement the Petrol Subsidy Programme (PSP) which was mooted by the then Pakatan Harapan administration.

Title: PM kicks off National Month, fly Jalur Gemilang campaign
Teaser: Malaysians have been urged to liven up the spirit of National Day and Malaysia Day not just in the fight against Covid-19 pandemic but also in efforts to revive the economy.

Title: Heavier punishment for 'basikal lajak' offences
Teaser: Punishment for offences related to “basikal lajak” (modified bicycles) and other micromobility vehicles will be heavier under the Road Transport (Amendment) Act 2020.

Title: Govt to relaunch Shared Prosperity Vision 2030
Teaser: The government will relaunch the Shared Prosperity Vision 2030 (SPV 2030) sometime soon this year, Minister in the Prime Minister's Department (Special Function) Datuk Seri Mohd Redzuan Yusof said.

Title: PM: Economy recorded better-than-forecast 0.7pct growth in Q1 2020
Teaser: Malaysia recorded economic growth of 0.7 per cent in the first quarter of 2020, the Dewan Rakyat was told today.

Title: May 18 Parliament sitting valid, says affidavit filed by Dewan Rakyat secretary
Teaser: The single-day parliament sitting on May 18, which only saw the delivery of a royal address instead of a full traditional opening ceremony, remains valid.

Title: PM launches Census of Malaysia 2020
Teaser: Prime Minister Tan Sri Muhyiddin Yassin today launched Census of Malaysia 2020 that will chart the course for the country's future planning and development.

Title: 12MP to be reviewed, scheduled for tabling in Jan 2021, says Mustapa
Teaser: The 12th Malaysia Plan (12MP), which is scheduled to be tabled on on Aug 6, has been postponed to January next year to enable the government to undertake a review following the impacts on global economy brought on by the Covid-19 pandemic.

Title: Govt reactivates MySPC
Teaser: The government has decided to reactivate the Malaysia Social Protection Council (MySPC) with immediate effect, said Minister in the Prime Minister's Department (Economy) Datuk Seri Mustapa Mohamed.

Title: PM chairs JKKMAR meet via video conferencing
Teaser: The government has agreed in principle to recommendations by Malaysia Productivity Corporation (MPC) for all ministries and agencies responsible with issuing of licenses and permits to publish their respective guidelines on the application process.

Title: Mustapa: No decision on 'travel bubble' yet
Teaser: The government has received a proposal for the implementation of a 'travel bubble' with neighbouring countries but has not finalised its decision on the matter.

Title: PM launches Laksana Digital Dashboard
Teaser: Prime Minister Tan Sri Muhyiddin Yassin has launched the Laksana Digital Dashboard to help the government monitor the implementation of Prihatin and Penjana.

Title: Refund refusal: New law to deal with businesses
Teaser: A new law will be introduced to deal with business operators who refuse to refund their clients after the cancellation of events such as weddings during the Movement Control Order (MCO), Defence Minister Datuk Seri Ismail Sabri Yaakob said.

Title: Country to witness policy changes on employing foreigners
Teaser: The country will see big changes in the policy of employing foreign workers to curb the entry of illegal immigrants post Covid-19, said Senior Minister (Security Cluster) Datuk Seri Ismail Sabri Yaakob.

Title: Tengku Zafrul: M'sia's next economic stimulus zooms on 3 key goals
Teaser: Malaysia’s soon-to-be-unveiled Economic Recovery Plan (ERP) will focus on three main goals  empowering the rakyat, propelling businesses and stimulating the economy.

Title: Govt mulling freeze on issuance of liquor-selling licence
Teaser: The Housing and Local Government Ministry is ready to consider suspending the issuance of new licenses to sell liquor following a rise in the number of road accidents involving drunk drivers.

Title: New law in the pipeline to mitigate Covid-19 impact
Teaser: The government is proposing a new Temporary Implementation Measures law to mitigate the economic, social and industrial impact of Covid-19.

Title: M'sia's corporate liability provision to take effect on June 1
Teaser: The Malaysian Anti-Corruption Commission’s (MACC) corporate liability law will come into force on June 1.

Title: Covid-19 effects will not impact 12th Malaysia Plan, says Tengku Zafrul
Teaser: The 12th Malaysia Plan (12MP) is not currently seen as being negatively impacted by the effects of the Covid-19 pandemic, said Finance Minister Tengku Datuk Seri Zafrul Abdul Aziz.

Title: 12th Malaysia Plan to be reviewed, restructured in wake of Covid-19
Teaser: The government will restructure the 12th Malaysia Plan (12MP) by taking into account the impacts of Covid-19, which has caused economic slowdown in the country as well as globally.

Title: Cabinet members to give two months' salary to Covid-19 fund
Teaser: All Cabinet members’ salaries will be deducted for the next two months and it will be forwarded to the Covid-19 fund, the Prime Minister’s Office (PMO) announced today.

Title: Six-month moratorium on bank loans, restructuring of credit card payments
Teaser: The government has announced a six-month moratorium on loan repayments and the restructuring of outstanding credit card balances involving about RM100 billion starting April 1.

Title: More comprehensive measures to be unveiled next week
Teaser: Prime Minister Tan Sri Muhyiddin Yassin will unveil a more "comprehensive" economic stimulus package and assistance for the people on Mar 30.

Title: Economic stimulus package to be reviewed
Teaser: The government has agreed to review the economic stimulus package launched by the previous Pakatan Harapan government.

Title: Economic Action Council formed
Teaser: As the dust settled after a political tumultuous period, newly-minted Prime Minister Tan Sri Muhyiddin Yassin wasted no time in working his machinery to get Malaysia's economy back on track.

Title: Stimulus package to facilitate cash flow of businesses
Teaser: The 2020 Economic Stimulus Package will assist businesses most adversely affected by Covid-19 to facilitate their cash flow and reduce business costs, Interim Prime Minister Tun Dr Mahathir Mohamad said.

Title: RM20 billion for 2020 Economic Stimulus Package
Teaser: Interim Prime Minister Tun Dr Mahathir Mohamad today announced RM20 billion Economic Stimulus Package to economic risks associated with COVID-19 outbreak can be addressed effectively.

Title: Malaysians@Work initiative to open for registration in April
Teaser: The Malaysians@Work or #MalaysiaKerja initiative, to be spearheaded by the Employees Provident Fund (EPF), will open for registration in April.

Title: Move to set up Commission to reconcile aggrieved parties without involving police
Teaser: The Bill to set up the Harmony and Reconciliation Commission is expected to be tabled in Parliament this year.

Title: Stimulus package to be announced soon
Teaser: The government is expected to announce a stimulus package to cushion the impact of the ongoing novel coronavirus outbreak latest by early next month.

Title: Malaysia will not use nuclear power, says PM
Teaser: Malaysia will not use nuclear power as a renewable energy source as the country’s knowledge in the field is inadequate, said Prime Minister Tun Dr Mahathir Mohamad.

Title: Malaysia, Pakistan ink extradition treaty
Teaser: Malaysia and Pakistan have formally signed a treaty on extradition today.

Title: Science and Mathematics to be taught in English again
Teaser: Science and Mathematics subjects will once again be taught in English.

Title: Do not abuse government aid, or risk it being revoked
Teaser: Prime Minister Tun Dr Mahathir Mohamad today said he would not hesitate to revoke government aids notably on cases of the Approved Permits (APs) being abused and sold off for profit.

Title: Malaysia to announce additional measures to prevent spread of new China virus
Teaser: Malaysia has taken note of the World Health Organisation (WHO) announcement that it would convene an emergency panel meeting this week on the Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome-(SARS) like virus which has spread beyond China’s borders.

Title: RM66mil e-Tunai Rakyat disbursed so far [NSTTV]
Teaser: A total RM66 million has been disbursed to the people under the RM30 e-Tunai Rakyat initiative as of 9pm yesterday, Finance Minister Lim Guan Eng said.

Title: Dr Habibah Abdul Rahim appointed as Education director-general
Teaser: Dr Habibah Abdul Rahim has been appointed as the new Education director-general effective Jan 10.

Title: PM: Malaysia is a rich country...but people not willing to work hard to reap the benefits
Teaser: Bad values among certain quarters prevented the country from tapping into its actual potential in achieving greater economic growth.

Title: e-Tunai Rakyat application period starts Jan 15; free RM30 for all [NSTTV]
Teaser: Malaysians aged 18 and above, with an annual income of RM100,000 and below, will be able to apply for the e-Tunai Rakyat initiative beginning 8am tomorrow (Jan 15).

Title: Guan Eng: Government to adopt 'considerate approach' towards taxpayers
Teaser: The government needs to achieve an equilibrium to increase revenue through tax collections while at the same time not burden taxpayers, Finance Minister Lim Guan Eng said today.

Title: Dr M: Interim education minister only temporary
Teaser: Prime Minister Tun Dr Mahathir Mohamad has stressed that he will cease being the interim education minister once a suitable person is found to take over as the minister.

Title: PM: Malaysia heading in the right direction
Teaser: Prime Minister Tun Dr Mahathir Mohamad today reassured that the Pakatan Harapan (PH) government has a clear direction for the country despite being criticised.

Title: No toll hikes in 2020
Teaser: Pakatan Harapan (PH) is retaining its freeze on toll hikes for 2020.

Title: PM: Civil servants must resolve to help develop Malaysia
Teaser: Government sector workers’ resolutions for 2020 should be to work harder for the sake of Malaysia’s progress, regardless of their political affiliations, said Prime Minister Tun Dr Mahathir Mohamad.

Title: PM hands over letter of appointment to Mohd Zuki
Teaser: Prime Minister Tun Dr Mahathir Mohamad today received a courtesy visit from the new Chief Secretary to the Government, Datuk Seri Mohd Zuki Ali, and his predecessor Tan Sri Dr Ismail Bakar.

Title: Muhyiddin: Govt to form single border agency
Teaser: A border agency will be formed to oversee and strengthen security along national borders, said Home Minister Tan Sri Muhyiddin Yassin.

Title: Only new intake affected by critical allowance cut, says PSD
Teaser: The abolishing of the Critical Service Incentive Payment (BIPK) will only affect civil servants who are appointed from January 1, 2020.

Title: 'Govt targets to eliminate middlemen'
Teaser: The government is studying ways to reduce food prices and raise the income of producers by eliminating middlemen in the supply chain.

Title: Liew: No reports of civil servants defying new govt
Teaser: There have been no reports or cases of civil servants not complying with the new government in implementing its policies.

Title: MCMC removes 78 per cent of fake social media accounts detected
Teaser: A total of 3,877 fake accounts on social media have been detected, 78 per cent of which have been deleted by the Malaysian Communications and Multimedia Commission (MCMC) as of September, the Dewan Rakyat was told today.

Title: Liew: MPs who fail to declare assets after Dec 5 deadline can be suspended
Teaser: The Dewan Rakyat Speaker can cite members of parliament (MPs) who fail to declare their assets after the Dec 5 deadline for contempt.

Title: HRDF registration on steady rise, says chairman
Teaser: The number of registered Malaysian employers and employees under the Human Resources Development Fund (HRDF) has steadily increased after Pakatan Harapan took over the government in May last year.

Title: Amendment on Environmental Act to be tabled in Parliament next year
Teaser: The proposed amendment to the Environmental Quality Act 1974 is expected to be tabled in Parliament next year.

Title: PM: Draconian laws such as Sosma to be amended as soon as possible
Teaser: Draconian laws, such as the Security Offences (Special Measures) Act 2012 (Sosma), will be amended as soon as possible.

Title: Loke: Transport Ministry never introduced new legislation for lorry drivers [NSTTV]
Teaser: Transport Minister Anthony Loke said today that his ministry has not introduced new regulations or policies for lorry services.

Title: Study on Sedition Act ongoing to ensure no loopholes
Teaser: The government is still carrying out a study on the Sedition Act 1948 to ensure that offences against the royal institution, races and religions (3Rs) are maintained, if it is repealed.

Title: Govt to speed up decriminalisation of drug addiction among youth
Teaser: The government has formed a special committee to speed up the process of decriminalising drug addiction among youth.

Title: Dr M: Farmers must change mindset and diversify
Teaser: BAKU, Azerbaijan: Farmers are encouraged to venture into mixed farming on a large scale so that they can reap higher returns.

Title: Dr M: Malaysia to open embassy to aid Palestine
Teaser: BAKU, Azerbaijan: As a counter to Israel's claim of Jerusalem as its capital and western countries support of it, Malaysia will open an embassy accredited to Palestine.

Title: Cabinet gives green light to new Islamic administrative policy paper
Teaser: The Cabinet today endorsed the country’s new Islamic administrative policy paper, based on the Rahmah principles.

Title: NAM members must uphold cardinal rule of Bandung principle
Teaser: BAKU, Azerbaijan: Repatriation of the Rohingya in a voluntary, safe and dignified manner must begin immediately.

Title: Budget constraints, poor training hampering efforts to tackle child sex crimes
Teaser: Budget constraints and insufficient training for staff handling victims of child sex crimes are hampering the government’s efforts to ensure justice is done in these cases.

Title: RM5.1b set aside to pay 1MDB, SRC debt service for 2019, 2020
Teaser: The government has set aside RM5.1 billion to pay off 1Malaysia Development Bhd’s (1MDB) and SRC International Sdn Bhd’s (SRC) debt service with RM2.4 billion for this year and RM2.7 billion for next year.

Title: Govt still reviewing aviation regulatory bodies, says PM
Teaser: The government is still reviewing all institutions and regulatory bodies in the aviation sector, including the Malaysian Aviation Commission (Mavcom), to see if there is a need to disband them.

Title: PM: Civil servants entitled to pension scheme benefits
Teaser: Prime Minister Tun Dr Mahathir Mohamad today assured civil servants currently in service that they are entitled to receive pension benefits upon retirement.

Title: Sabah and Sarawak urged to amend wildlife laws to tackle poaching and smuggling
Teaser: Sabah and Sarawak have been urged to amend their wildlife protection laws to increase punishments for wildlife crimes.

Title: Flying car prototype to be ready by year end: Redzuan
Teaser: Malaysia’s flying car prototype is expected to be launched by the end of the year, says Entrepreneur Development Minister Datuk Seri Mohd Redzuan Md Yusof.

Title: NFCP to bridge Orang Asli digital gap
Teaser: Implementation of the National Fiberisation and Connectivity Plan (NFCP) will provide broadband access facilities in Orang Asli villages to further reduce the digital divide.

Title: Malaysia still needs Sosma, says Muhyiddin
Teaser: Malaysia still needs the Security Offences (Special Measures) Act 2012 (Sosma) to fight terrorism activities in the country, says Home Minister Tan Sri Muhyiddin Yassin.

Title: LCCs, poverty among focus of Dewan Rakyat today
Teaser: The government's move to encourage low cost carriers either locally or internationally so that more Malaysians can enjoy cheaper air fares, is expected to steal the show at the Dewan Rakyat today.

Title: Proactive steps demonstrate govt transparency in managing country's finances
Teaser: The government has taken several proactive measures to demonstrate its transparency in managing the country’s finances, says Finance Minister Lim Guan Eng.

Title: PM: Price threshold for foreign property ownership lowered to avert crisis
Teaser: The government’s decision to lower the threshold on the prices of condominiums and apartments in urban areas for foreign ownership was made to prevent the country from descending into an economic crisis caused by a property supply overhang.

Title: A-G's Report: Ceiling on government-guaranteed loans should be set
Teaser: A policy on capping government-guaranteed loans should be established, said the Auditor-General’s Report for the federal government’s financial statement for the year 2018.

Title: 2020 Budget: Home Ministry allocation raised to RM16.9 billion
Teaser: The Home Ministry’s budget allocation has been increased from RM15.6 billion for this year to RM16.9 billion for next year.

Title: NGOs say govt's 'women friendly' incentives timely
Teaser: THE 2020 Budget has been hailed by non-governmental organisations and women activists as putting women issues at the centre of focus. In particular, it offers a slew of incentives to enhance women’s participation in the workforce.

Title: 'Yes, GST will increase prices' [NSTTV]
Teaser: A consumer group and an economist have voiced their take on the Sales and Services Tax (SST) versus the Goods and Services Tax (GST) dilemma.

Title: MEF lauds #MalaysiaKerja initiative [NSTTV]
Teaser: The Malaysian Employers Federation (MEF) has applauded the Malaysians@Work or #MalaysiaKerja initiative as it will create better employment opportunities for youths, women and the latent workforce.

Title: 2020 Budget: 'e-Sports allocation should be used on SEA Games athletes, ruling' [NSTTV]
Teaser: E-Sports associations welcomed the RM20 million allocation for local e-Sports industry, hoping that the money will be used on the 2019 SEA Games athletes and develop e-Sports regulations.

Title: 2020 Budget: Mixed reaction to biodiversity allocation
Teaser: 2020 Budget’s allocation for preserving the environment has drawn mixed reactions from environmentalists and academics.

Title: RM60 million to kickstart pneumococcal vaccination for children
Teaser: The government remains committed to ensuring access to quality healthcare for all, as part of its aspiration of creating an inclusive Malaysian society, through an allocation of RM30.6 billion for next year.

Title: 2020 Budget: Government plans to spend RM450m on electric buses
Teaser: The government plans to invest RM450 million to acquire up to 500 electric buses of various sizes to boost public transport in selected cities nationwide.

Title: Pikom welcomes Budget incentives, calls for setting up of Tech Ministry
Teaser: The National ICT Association of Malaysia (Pikom) has praised the Government’s direct and indirect incentives for the information and communications technology (ICT) industry as outlined in the 2020 Budget today.

Title: 'What about your promise to abolish the Penang Bridge toll?'
Teaser: Gerakan has taken Finance Minister Lim Guan Eng to task over his failure to keep his promise to abolish the Penang Bridge toll.

Title: 2020 Budget: Artiste groups give thumbs up on increased EPF protection
Teaser: Finance Minister Lim Guan Eng's announcement in the 2020 Budget that the Employees Provident Fund (EPF) will increase protection to workers under contract in the entertainment industry, has been welcomed by artiste associations.

Title: 2020 Budget: RM48mil to preserve forests, natural biodiversity
Teaser: The government will allocate RM48 million to preserve Malaysia’s pristine forests and natural biodiversity.

Title: 2020 Budget: Empowering Bumiputera institutions, entrepreneurs
Teaser: The government is allocating RM8 billion to assist Bumiputera institutions and entrepreneurs under the 2020 Budget, compared with RM7.6 billion allocated this year.

Title: 2020 Budget: Extra goodies for civil servants [NSTTV]
Teaser: The government will fork out a special payment of RM500 each for civil servants of Grade 56 and below.

Title: 2020 Budget: RM10b allocation for rent-to-own financing scheme
Teaser: The government will collaborate with financial institutions to introduce a Rent To Own (RTO) financing scheme to assist those unable to afford the initial 10 per cent deposit and access to financing to buy homes.

Title: 2020 Budget: RM100m to repair and refurbish low, medium-cost high-rise residential schemes
Teaser: The government will set aside RM100 million for the repair and refurbishment of low and medium-cost strata housing.

Title: 2020 Budget: New tax band proposed for high-income earners
Teaser: The government has proposed to introduce a new band for taxable income in excess of RM2 million and taxed at 30 per cent, which is a 2 percentage point increase from the current 28 per cent rate.

Title: 2020 Budget: More opportunities for Grade 1 Bumi contractors
Teaser: The government is expanding opportunities for more Bumiputra contractors to take part in its procurement programme.

Title: 2020 Budget: Minimum penalty of RM100,000 proposed for illegal gamblers
Teaser: The government will propose a higher minimum penalty of RM100,000 for illegal gamblers.

Title: 2020 Budget: From 2021, Malaysians will be assigned Tax Identification Numbers
Teaser: Malaysians above the age of 18, as well as corporate entities, will be assigned a Tax Identification Number or TIN.

Title: Second Penang Bridge toll rate for cars reduced by RM1.50
Teaser: There will be a minimum of 18 per cent reduction of average toll charges across all PLUS highways.

Title: 2020 Budget: More funds for rice farmers, cash crops to supplement income
Teaser: The Government has increased the allocation for the Agriculture and Agro-based Industry Ministry from RM4.4 billion in 2019 to RM4.9 billion in 2020, in an effort to enhance farmers' income.

Title: 2020 Budget: RM85 million to ease congestion at Causeway
Teaser: To ease congestion at the Johor Baru Causeway and Second Link, the Government will allocate RM85 million beginning 2020, towards enhancing vehicle and traffic flow through the Customs, Immigration and Quarantine Complex (CIQ).

Title: 2020 Budget: Improved loan scheme to help SMEs
Teaser: The Skim Jaminan Pinjaman Perniagaan (SJPP) will be enhanced to better facilitate access to financing for small and medium enterprises (SMEs).

Title: 2020 Budget: RM2.2 billion for targeted fuel subsidy scheme
Teaser: The government will allocate RM2.2 billion for the proposed Fuel Subsidy Programme (PSP), which is set to benefit more than eight million motorists nationwide.

Title: Education Ministry largest 2020 Budget recipient with RM64.1b [NSTTV]
Teaser: The Education Ministry is the biggest recipient of the 2020 Budget with an allocation of RM64.1 billion, RM3.9 billion more than this year's allocation.

Title: Finance Ministry: Productivity-linked wage system to benefit employers, employees
Teaser: The implementation of the Productivity-linked Wage System (PLWS) is expected to benefit both employers and employees and ensure that both sides obtain a fair share of the gains from productivity or performance improvement, says the Finance Ministry.

Title: 2020 Budget: Gov't will honour loan commitments inherited from previous administration
Teaser: The government's commitment to repay all loan obligations inherited from the past administration has never wavered, said Finance Minister Lim Guan Eng.

Title: 2020 Budget: Soft loans for oil palm replanting incentives
Teaser: Finance Minister Lim Guan Eng, in tabling the 2020 Budget in Parliament today, expressed the government’s concern over the impact of low rubber and palm oil prices on planters’ livelihoods, especially smallholders.

Title: 2020 Budget: More tax relief for parents utilising childcare services
Teaser: Parents who send their children to daycare centres and kindergartens will enjoy double the amount of individual tax relief, from the current RM1,000 to RM2,000.

Title: 2020 Budget: RM70 million for Digital Enhancement Centres nationwide [NSTTV]
Teaser: The government has allocated RM70 million to build 14 one-stop Digital Enhancement Centres in all states to facilitate access to financing and capacity-building for businesses, especially small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs).

Title: BSH scheme to include single Malaysians above 40 earning under RM2,000 monthly
Teaser: The Bantuan Sara Hidup (BSH) programme will be expanded to include single Malaysians aged 40 and above who earn less than RM2,000 a month.

Title: 2020 Budget: RM575 million for socio-economic aid programmes

Title: 2020 Budget: 5G Ecosystem Development grant to encourage technological innovation

Title: Finance Ministry: Overall gross exports to expand 1 per cent in 2020

Teaser: The government is expected to raise gross borrowings of RM135.2 billion or 8.9 per cent of Gross Domestic Product (GDP) in 2019, the Finance Ministry said today.

Title: Govt mulls MPI use for better picture on poverty, says Dr M

Teaser: The Women, Family and Community Development Ministry has completed its Gender Mainstreaming Framework to be recommended for adoption by all ministries and government agencies.

Title: No cabinet reshuffle, maybe changes in portfolio, says Dr M

Title: Kota Kinabalu studying possible ban of plastic straws

Title: Sim: Long-term plan for sports vital

Title: Govt mulling corporate governance taskforce

Title: Govt to declare war on human trafficking, forced labour [NSTTV]

Teaser: Deputy Prime Minister Datuk Seri Dr Wan Azizah Wan Ismail said today the government only promotes its own products but not private products.

Title: DPM: Malaysia to introduce welfare act for elderly

Teaser: Prime Minister Tun Dr Mahathir Mohamad today sent a strong message to his administration, reminding them on the need to be organised.

Title: Dispute will be settled through talks, Dr M
Teaser: The row over airspace and territorial water boundaries between Malaysia and Singapore will be resolved through talks, Prime Minister Tun Dr Mahathir Mohamad said.

Title: No job loss in banking sector despite going cashless, says Kulasegaran

Title: National cyber security policy to be introduced next year - Gobind Singh

Title: Johor expects RM8 bln in FDI next year

Title: Zero Reject Policy will not affect Malaysian students' access to education
